meta.name: description
meta.content: Lowell Joint School District serves K-8 grade students in areas of Whitter, La Habra, and La Habra Heights.

article.aria-label: Rancho Starbuck Staff shares some words of encouragement with their students!

img.alt: Rancho Starbuck Staff shares some words of encouragement with their students! Featured Photo

h3.a: Rancho Starbuck Staff shares some words of encouragement with their students!

div.div: Thank you Rancho Starbuck staff for sharing such happy thoughts. We know how much you miss your students and how much they miss you. We can't wait to see the school full of students next year!

img.alt: Thank you El Portal Panthers! Featured Photo

div.div: Thank you to the entire staff of El Portal for putting together this uplifting video! The time spent to get this uplifting message out to all the El Portal students means so much! We are so grateful to have such amazing teachers and staff in our district.

article.aria-label: Thank you to our Macy Eagles Staff!!

img.alt: Thank you to our Macy Eagles Staff!! Featured Photo

h3.a: Thank you to our Macy Eagles Staff!!

div.div: Thank you Macy Staff for the uplifting words! And thank you for reminding the students how much you miss them! We are so grateful for such great teachers!

article.aria-label: Thank you to our Meadow Green Teachers!!

h3.a: Thank you to our Meadow Green Teachers!!

div.div: Our Meadow Green Teachers put a thoughtful collage together to show their students how much they miss them. Thank you to all our teachers for keeping our students in your thoughts and making them feel special while they learn from home.

article.aria-label: Inter/Intra District Transfer Forms and 2020/2021 Welcome Packets Available Here!

img.alt: Inter/Intra District Transfer Forms and 2020/2021 Welcome Packets Available Here! Featured Photo

h3.a: Inter/Intra District Transfer Forms and 2020/2021 Welcome Packets Available Here!

div.div:
If you live in the Lowell Joint School District and want to attend a school outside of your home school or if you live outside of the district and are interested in attending our school district, please fill out the attached forms and return to Katie Atkinson at katkinson@ljsd.org.
AND Welcome packets for the 2020/2021 school year are now available on the website. TK, Kindergarten and grades 1-6 have separate welcome packets. Fill it out and return to your school or the District Office. We can't wait to see you next year!!!
We love seeing our students excel at distance learning with the help of their amazing teachers!! Thank you for all your hard work LJSD Team on keeping our students learning during these tough times.

img.alt: Thank you Jordan Jaguar Teachers! Featured Photo

div.div: Jordan teachers are coming together to let their students know they miss them and are thinking of them while they practice distance learning.

article.aria-label: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

h3.a: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

div.div: Time: 6 PM – 8:30 PM

Location: In compliance with Government Code 54953, the Board will use zoom teleconference for closed session beginning at 6:00 p.m. zoom meeting ID: 784 7272 8007. To get the password to join the meeting please email: helpdesk@ljsd.org.
Open session begins at 7:30 p.m. via zoom meeting ID: 993-7300-2372. To get the password to join the meeting please email: helpdesk@ljsd.org.

article.aria-label: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

h3.a: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

div.div: Time: 7:30 PM – 8:30 PM
Location: Lowell Joint School District Board Room - 11019 Valley Home Avenue, Whittier 90603

article.aria-label: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

h3.a: Lowell Joint Board of Trustees Board Meeting

div.div: Time: 7:30 PM – 8:30 PM
Location: Lowell Joint School District Board Room - 11019 Valley Home Avenue, Whittier 90603

The Lowell Joint School District is committed to providing a strong academic program of 21st Century Skills with a well-rounded program of diverse and innovative subject offerings. All District Schools emphasize the importance of education, the family, and traditional values. We stress the value of personal integrity, social responsibility, and a respect for our national heritage.​ The Lowell Joint School District envisions a culture where technology empowers all members of the school community to achieve success and expand learning beyond the walls of the classroom. All stakeholders will utilize technology to become highly competent in a technological world through continuous improvement in academics, career, and life.
